content:
Merhabalar, Şirket bilgisayarıma Firefox tarayıcısını kurdum ve bazı uzantıları kullanmak istiyorum. Ancak, uzantıları doğrudan Firefox eklenti mağazasından indirmem mümkün değil. Bu nedenle, ilgili eklentileri .xpi uzantılı dosyalar şeklinde manuel olarak indirdim. Fakat bu dosyaları yüklemeye çalıştığımda “uzantı dosyası bozuk” şeklinde bir hata alıyorum. Bu konuda nasıl bir çözüm uygulayabilirim? --- Hello, I installed the Firefox browser on my company computer and would like to use some extensions. However, I'm unable to download them directly from the Firefox Add-ons store. As a workaround, I downloaded the extensions manually in the form of .xpi files. But when I try to install them, I get an error saying that the extension file is corrupted. What can I do to resolve this issue?

Thank you.

title: Downloads stuck, "unknown time left" - error in terminal
content:
Hello! I'm trying to download a quantity of audio files from a specific website. Once I open firefox, I can manage to download a few in that session - anywhere from 1 to 10 usually. Then, at some point, the downloads start to hang. They appear as how they do when they're loading - "Unknown time left - 0 bytes (0 bytes/sec)". However, they never load. The only solution is to restart Firefox, to be able to download a few more.

I'm on Linux mint, Firefox version 137.0.2 (64-bit). I tried running firefox through the terminal to see if anything would show up when the downloads stop working, and I got this:

[GFX1-]: RenderCompositorSWGL failed mapping default framebuffer, no dt [Child 47831, Main Thread] WARNING: Unable to open /var/lib/flatpak/exports/share/dconf/profile/user: Permission denied: 'glib warning', file /builds/worker/checkouts/gecko/toolkit/xre/nsSigHandlers.cpp:201

(/usr/lib/firefox/firefox-bin:47831): dconf-WARNING **: 17:00:51.332: Unable to open /var/lib/flatpak/exports/share/dconf/profile/user: Permission denied [Child 47834, Main Thread] WARNING: Unable to open /var/lib/flatpak/exports/share/dconf/profile/user: Permission denied: 'glib warning', file /builds/worker/checkouts/gecko/toolkit/xre/nsSigHandlers.cpp:201

(/usr/lib/firefox/firefox-bin:47834): dconf-WARNING **: 17:01:05.497: Unable to open /var/lib/flatpak/exports/share/dconf/profile/user: Permission denied [Child 47553, Main Thread] WARNING: Unable to open /var/lib/flatpak/exports/share/dconf/profile/user: Permission denied: 'glib warning', file /builds/worker/checkouts/gecko/toolkit/xre/nsSigHandlers.cpp:201

(/usr/lib/firefox/firefox-bin:47553): dconf-WARNING **: 17:01:14.186: Unable to open /var/lib/flatpak/exports/share/dconf/profile/user: Permission denied

And a lot of "ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment." - but those seem to happen all the time during regular usage.

Any way I can go about troubleshooting this, or am I stuck with restarting Firefox every few files I need to download? Thank you in advance for any help or advice.
creator: clorofolle

title: Line break (\r\n) missing in clipboard after Firefox update – breaks formatting in Windows apps
content:
Hello!

After the latest Firefox Desktop updates (not sure which one exactly, since I didn't notice the issue immediately), I've started experiencing a problem with copy-pasting text — specifically with line break formatting on Windows 10.

Instead of copying line breaks using the Windows-style carriage return + line feed ( ), Firefox now copies only line feeds ( ). As a result, the text appears as a single long line when pasted into native Windows applications — which breaks the expected formatting. This behavior mainly affects:

  • Text editable fields (e.g., contenteditable or textarea) in modern web applications.
  • Code blocks or snippets (such as in Markdown or monospace) copied using "Copy" buttons (e.g., in ChatGPT or GitHub).

At first, I noticed this only when copying code from ChatGPT using the code-snippet copy button. But now it happens in almost all editable text areas — if I enter text with line breaks manually, and then copy it, those breaks do not appear properly in native Windows apps. For example:

  • In Google Sheets, I often edit text with line breaks in a cell, but when I copy it back, it's all flattened into one line.

Right now, I have to fix this using scripts that replace with , but that's a very inconvenient workaround.

❗My main question is: What changed in Firefox that caused this behavior? This used to be reliable and feels like a regression. It’s a very basic feature and critically important for my daily workflow!

🔧 Follow-up questions:

  1. Can this be fixed in a future Firefox update? Will it be addressed?
  2. Is there a way to fix or configure this behavior right now via browser(settings, configs)?
  3. Is there an extension or workaround that can restore the format without manual scripting?

Affected apps:

  • ChatGPT
  • Google Spreadsheets
  • Trello
  • ProtonMail (regular text copying)
  • (more)

Thanks in advance for any clarification or suggestions!

title: Crashing while streaming video
content:
I get random crashes while streaming video (for example youtube). I am using a laptop with 2 GPUs (integrated AMD and dedicated Nvidia) and a secondary monitor. If the Firefox windows is on the laptop display I never get crashes but on the secondary display I get around 1-2/hour. Also, this only happens with hardware acceleration enabled in Firefox settings, if I deactivate it then the issue is gone. I think it runs on the AMD integrated graphics, based on what I see in task manager. I also have uBlock origin, haven't tried deactivating it yet. The crashses consist in a black screen from which I can only recorver by doing a hard reset.

Any suggestions on what to try?

title: The user's open tabs in the sidebar continue to show when the f11 full screen key is pressed.
content: Firefox recently offered a choice of having open tabs appear in a sidebar on the left side. This is great but the tabs and sidebar stay visible when engaging the f11 full screen mode. This makes an awkward appearance when trying to view in full screen - such as movies or any other. The address bar at the top is hidden with f11, but the side tabs and their vertical side bar remain visible. I believe Firefox would be more desirable if the f11 key also hid the side bar. This is how Microsoft's Edge browser functions. Can't have a true full screen if the sidebar and tabs remain visible. The full screen functions works well if the sidebar function is turned off in settings but this makes it awkward for a user who wishes to use the sidebar tabs with a full screen mode. Thank you for considering this issue and thank you for your great products. Tom
